param.name: appliance_hostname
param.doc: Host name of the appliance.

method.name: PUT
method.doc: To complete this operation with the RESTful web service, issue an HTTP PUT command on the runtime tuning resource URI. All parameters are optional for this web service. If no parameters are specified, or if an invalid value is given for one or more parameters, no modifications will be made.

param.name: Authorization
param.doc: Basic Authentication header

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service

param.name: accept_client_certs
param.doc: Controls whether client certificates will be accepted by the server.

param.name: require_mtls
param.doc: Controls whether access to the server requires authentication using MTLS.

param.name: enabled_server_protocols
param.doc: Specifies which secure protocols will be accepted when connecting to the server. The value should correspond to a supported IBMJSSE2 option. The current supported options include: TLS, TLSv1, TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2.

param.name: enable_sso
param.doc: Controls whether the LTPA single sign-on cookie is supported by the server.

param.name: auto_restart
param.doc: Controls whether or not the runtime profile will be automatically restarted when configuration changes are deployed that require a restart to take effect.

param.name: auto_reload
param.doc: Controls whether or not the runtime profile will be automatically reloaded when configuration changes are deployed that require a reload to take effect.

param.name: trace_specification
param.doc: Specifies the initial state for various trace components. This value conforms to the trace specification grammar.

param.name: suppress_sensitive_trace
param.doc: Indicates whether to stop potentially sensitive information from being exposed in log and trace files.

param.name: session_max_count
param.doc: Maximum number of sessions to allow in the session cache.

param.name: session_invalidation_timeout
param.doc: Amount of time a session can go unused before it is no longer valid.

param.name: session_reaper_poll_interval
param.doc: The wake-up interval, in seconds, for the process that removes invalid sessions. The minimum value is 30 seconds. If a value less than the minimum is entered, an appropriate value is automatically determined and used. This value overrides the default installation value, which is between 30 and 360 seconds, based off the session timeout value. Because the default session timeout is 30 minutes, the reaper interval is usually between 2 and 3 minutes.

param.name: max_heap_size
param.doc: The maximum size of the JVM heap in MB.

param.name: min_heap_size
param.doc: The minimum/initial size of the JVM in MB.

param.name: max_threads
param.doc: The maximum number of threads which will handle runtime requests. A default value of -1 is used. Any value that is less than or equal to 0 means the maximum number of threads is set to unlimited.

param.name: min_threads
param.doc: The minimum number of threads which will handle runtime requests. A default value of -1 is used. Any value that is less than or equal to 0 means the minimum number of threads is set to the number of hardware threads.

param.name: enable_crldp
param.doc: Whether CRL distribution point checking for the PKIX trust manager is enabled.

param.name: dns_resolution_cache_lifetime
param.doc: The lifetime of the DNS resolution result cache.

param.name: keystore
param.doc: The name of the key database to use as the keystore.

param.name: keystore_label
param.doc: The name of the key in the keystore to be used as the SSL configurations key. This attribute is only required if the keystore has more than one key entry in it. If the keystore has more than one key entry and this attribute does not specify a key, then the JSSE picks a key.

param.name: truststore
param.doc: The name of the key database to use as the truststore.

param.name: endpoints
param.doc: Information on all configured endpoints.

param.name: id
param.doc: The interface and port, separated by a ':' character.

param.name: interface
param.doc: This is a combination of the interface and IP address UUIDs, separated by a '.' character. To use the DHCP address on an adapter, replace the address UUID with either "dhcp.ipv4" for the IPv4 DHCP address or "dhcp.ipv6" for the IPv6 DHCP address. The special identifier all-application-interfaces may also be used to indicate that all application IP addresses will be used.

param.name: port
param.doc: The port the endpoint will listen on.

param.name: secure
param.doc: Indicates whether the endpoint will use SSL.
